result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornelius Tremayne Powell

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Cornelius Tremayne Powell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Cornelius Tremayne Powell.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a review hearing. Defendant has been transferred to Mendota for treatment. Parties does not object to findings filed by Dr. Seipel. Court adopts the findings that the defendant remains incompetent, likely to regain competency. Defendant's commitment remains. Court adjourns matter for a review hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Review hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk
Received and Filed: Attorney Angel Johnson
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report - 8-19-22

Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court to clarify previous proceedings. Defense requests that the court adopt the findings from the doctor's report as discussed on June 24th, 2022. This case was not specifically mentioned in the written report.
Court adopts the findings in the doctor's report and finds that it should apply to this case as well. Court ordered all court proceedings suspended, and authorizes transfer of this case to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11.

Defendant Cornelius Tremayne Powell not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Parties appear via zoom.  This matter addressed with Defendant's felony on June 24, 2022.  Court adjourns matter.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Cornelius Tremayne Powell in court with Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard in Branch 25 for Branch 30.  The Case in court for Return on Doctor's Report on 19CF5219,20CF99,20CF234,20CF2058 and 20CM76.  The parties are requesting the court to adapt the Doctor's Report in this matter.    Defendant does not challenge doctor's report.  Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The proceedings are suspended.  The defendant will continue to receive out patient treatment Thur the Department of Health and Family Services.  The Court Order the matter adjourned to Branch 28. 
 Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  
  Review hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-27-2022, Received and Filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Cornelius Tremayne Powell in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Cornelius Tremayne Powell in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cornelius Tremayne Powell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
